_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Risk Management Plan-Executive Summary



Facility:  WinField United

Location:  1413 FM 2378

           Lubbock, TX  79407

Phone:     806-885-4678



1.     Facility Policy.



        The owners, management and employees of WinField United are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Lubbock County LEPC, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the people and the environment.



2.     Facility Information.



        The primary activity at the facility is the manufacturer and distribution of fertilizer products to retailers of farm supplies.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia is received and used in the manufacturer of other liquid fertilizers  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.



3.     Accidental Release Prevention Program



        The facility is in compliance with the provisions of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia" and our state regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.  



5.      Five-Year Accident History.



         There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has THERE BEEN ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASES resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage, or environmental damage.



6.       Emergency Action Plan.



          The facility has:



           a.     A written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA standard 

                   29 CFR 1910.38;



b.     Provided state and local authorities with the emergency planning and 

                   Community right-to-know information as required under SARA Title III 

                   (EPCRA).



           c.     If a large

release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at the facility, 

                   the required response action is to evacuate the area of the spill and 

                   call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers listed in our

                   Emergency Action Plan.



7.       Planned Changes to Improve Safety.



          Safety improvement is an on-going process at the facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of this facility.  There are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding storage or use of anhydrous ammonia for implementation at this time.
